OVERVIEW: Typically, Yochum soils have light reddish brown, very friable, noncalcareous, platy A2 horizons and medium acid very gravelly sandy loam B2t horizons in which silicate clay is accumulating as lamellae, over noncalcareous sandstone and loamstone at a depth of 26 inches.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive Lamellic Haplocryalfs

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Yochum gravelly sandy loam - forest.
(Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
01--2 to 1 inches; undecomposed organic material principally needles, bark, twigs, and leaves.
02--1 inch to 0; partially decomposed material like that of the horizon above.
A2--0 to 8 inches; light reddish brown (5YR 6/4) gravelly sandy loam, reddish brown (5YR 5/4) moist; weak thick platy structure that parts to medium granules; soft, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; 20 percent gravel; medium acid (pH 5.6); clear wavy boundary.  (4 to 23 inches thick)
B2t--8 to 26 inches; mixed light reddish brown (5YR 6/4) and reddish brown (2.5YR 5/4) very gravelly sandy loam containing discontinuous lenses and seams of heavy sandy loam, sandy clay loam, loam, and clay loam, reddish brown (5YR 5/4) and reddish brown (2.5Y 4/4) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; some of the more clayey peds are hard, friable, slightly sticky, slightly plastic; few wax-like patches on the faces of the more clayey peds and in root channels and pores in these areas; wax-like coatings on some of the coarse fragments and as bridges between sand grains; 50 percent gravel; medium acid (pH 6.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (7 to 50 inches thick)
C--26 to 40 inches; reddish brown noncalcareous sandstone and loamstone.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Jackson County, Colorado; approximately 2.3 miles above Bockman's Lumber Camp on Montgomery Pass Road in NW1/4 Sec. 29, T. 7 N., R. 76 W. (unsurveyed).

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Mean annual soil temperature is about 40 degrees F., and mean summer soil temperature is about 51 degrees F. A thin dark colored Al horizon is present in some pedons.  Base saturation ranges from 60 to 100 percent in all subhorizons of the argillic horizon.  Depth to the paralithic contact ranges from 20 to 40 inches.  Depth to the top of the argillic horizon is less than 24 inches and depth to the base of the argillic horizon ranges from 17 to 40 inches.  Rock fragments range from 35 to 75 percent in a major part of the solum and any C horizon and are mainly 1/4 to 10 inches in diameter.
The A1 horizon, if present, has hue of 10YR through 5YR, value of 4 or 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 1 through 3.  It ranges from medium acid to neutral.
The A2 horizon has hue of 7.5YR through 2.5YR, value of 5 through 8 dry, 4 through 6 moist, and chroma of 1 through 6.  It ranges from medium acid to neutral.
The B2t horizon has hue of 5YR through 10R, value of 5 through 7 dry, 4 through 6 moist, and chroma of 1 through 6.  It is variable in texture with the horizon consisting of lamellae of sandy loam, sandy clay loam, loam or clay loam in a matrix of sandy loam.  If mixed proportionally to occurrence within the pedon the composite texture of the fine earth fraction is finer than loamy fine sand. This horizon ranges from medium acid to neutral.
The C horizon, if present above the bedrock, has hue of 5YR through 10R.   It is typically gravelly or very gravelly sandy loam.  This horizon ranges from medium acid to neutral.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Hyannis, Siebert, and Troutville series.  Hyannis, Siebert, and Troutville soils have hue of 7.5YR or yellower.  Also, Troutville soils lack a paralithic contact above a depth of 40 inches.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Yochum soils are on gently to steeply sloping hills, ridges, and mountainsides.  Slopes typically range from about 2 to 50 percent.  These soils formed in moderately thin reddish brown gravelly sandy loam materials weathered from red bed sandstones and loamstones.  At the type location the mean annual precipitation is about 20 inches with peak periods of precipitation in the spring and summer.  Mean annual temperature is 36 degrees F. and mean summer temperature is 52 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the competing Hyannis soils and the Muggins soils.  Muggins soils have fine textured argillic horizons.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; slow to very slow runoff; moderately rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used for grazing or for timber production.  Native vegetation is spruce, fir, lodgepole pine, juniper, and wild rose.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:   Mountainous areas of Colorado.  The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  OSED scanned by NSSQA.  Last revised by state 11/73.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.

HORIZONS.narrative: 01--2 to 1 inches; undecomposed organic material principally needles, bark, twigs, and leaves.

HORIZONS.name: A2
HORIZONS.narrative: A2--0 to 8 inches; light reddish brown (5YR 6/4) gravelly sandy loam, reddish brown (5YR 5/4) moist; weak thick platy structure that parts to medium granules; soft, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; 20 percent gravel; medium acid (pH 5.6); clear wavy boundary.  (4 to 23 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: B2t
HORIZONS.narrative: B2t--8 to 26 inches; mixed light reddish brown (5YR 6/4) and reddish brown (2.5YR 5/4) very gravelly sandy loam containing discontinuous lenses and seams of heavy sandy loam, sandy clay loam, loam, and clay loam, reddish brown (5YR 5/4) and reddish brown (2.5Y 4/4) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; some of the more clayey peds are hard, friable, slightly sticky, slightly plastic; few wax-like patches on the faces of the more clayey peds and in root channels and pores in these areas; wax-like coatings on some of the coarse fragments and as bridges between sand grains; 50 percent gravel; medium acid (pH 6.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (7 to 50 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: C
HORIZONS.narrative: C--26 to 40 inches; reddish brown noncalcareous sandstone and loamstone.
02--1 inch to 0; partially decomposed material like that of the horizon above.
